subject: Personal Finance
title: The Bandwagon Effect
description: A quick win: understand The Bandwagon Effect.

hook.text: Everyone at the office is buying crypto. You know nothing about it, but you want in too.

buildup.text: The bandwagon effect is our tendency to follow what the majority is doing.

discovery.text: It drove the Dutch tulip mania in 1637. People bought bulbs worth more than houses.

twist.text: The same force works in reverse. When everyone sells, panic creates a stampede.

climax.text: Markets don't just reflect value. They reflect the herd's emotions amplified by imitation.

punchline.text: If everyone is buying, ask why.

quiz.question: What historical event exemplifies the bandwagon effect?
options: The founding of the stock market
